title: FBI Files on James Abourezk

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI Files on James Abourezk
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-FBI files documented by agent Bob Cordier  on plans and attempts to murder, threaten, or harm Senator James Abourezk, between October 11th, 1985 and January 1st, 1987. 
-All FBI files relating to the investigation of  Alex Odeh that name Senator James Abourezk.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grey Moran

title: ChatGPT usage for Florida Court System

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: ChatGPT usage for Florida Court System
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am a researcher looking into the effect of chatGPT usage in courts. 
I would like access to 
1). email records related to chatgpt (including subscriptions, those sent to employees, those sent among judges, etc.)
2). chatgpt access data (IP logs) and if possible the identity of the user
3). ChatGPT chat records of judges and clerks in the Florida court system broadly, and Florida Supreme Court in particular

I want this record from 2020 to 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Sungho Park

title: KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – JEFFREY KNUTSON - Health and Fitness Teacher - Mattson Middle School - APPEAL OF SCHOOL BOARD’S ACTION - Case # 24-2-19679-0 KNT

communications.communication:
October 22, 2024 

KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – JEFFREY KNUTSON - Health and Fitness Teacher - Mattson Middle School - APPEAL OF SCHOOL BOARD’S ACTION - Case # 24-2-19679-0 KNT

Via email: PublicRecords@Kent.k12.wa.us

Excerpts from Case # 24-2-19679-0 KNT Pages 5-7:

On page two, the Board list allegations that allegedly substantiate the policy violation, including:

• Daily touching and rubbing of the student’s back and shoulders.
• Excessive hugging.
• Providing unsolicited gifts, including LED lights, a whistle, lanyard, and candy.
• Taking photos and selfies with the student, sometimes on Mr. Knutson’s phone.
• TikTok videos with inappropriate focus on the student’s body.
• Creating situations where the student had to be in close physical proximity to Mr. Knutson.
• Inappropriate verbal comments and gestures.
• Inviting the student to personal events outside of school.
• Suggesting to the student to maintain contact with Mr. Knutson after transitioning to high school.

On page two, under “Evidence and Impact,” the Board claims:

The evidence gathered, which included witness statements and documented interactions, supports the findings that Mr. Knutson’s actions, in totality, created a hostile educational environment for the student, as defined by Board Policy. The behaviors exhibited by Mr. Knutson, as documented, created an environment that significantly disrupted the student’s educational experience. The consistent pattern of unwelcome physical contact, inappropriate comments, and attempts to establish a personal relationship outside of school boundaries constitute clear violations of the Policy and Title IX regulations.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) regarding King County Case # 24-2-19679-0 KNT.
2. Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) regarding the allegations and investigation into Jeffrey Knutson.
3. Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) regarding all investigations into Jeffrey Knutson.
4. Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) regarding the Kent School Boards decisions in regard to Jeffery Knutson.


KING COUNTY NOTICE OF RCW 28A.645.010 APPEAL OF SCHOOL BOARD’S ACTION CASE #: 24-2-19679-0 KNT is attached to this request.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in the numerical order requested by subject matter and year. The most recent public records should be produced first.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES
In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.
WAC 44-14-03001 - "Public record" defined.

For most public records, the act uses a three-part test to determine if a record is a "public record." The document must be: A "writing," containing information "relating to the conduct of government" or the performance of any governmental or proprietary function, "prepared, owned, used, or retained" by an agency.
(1) Writing. A "public record" can be any writing "regardless of physical form or characteristics." RCW 42.56.010(3). "Writing" is defined very broadly as: "… handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated." RCW 42.56.010(4). An email, text, social media posting and database are therefore also "writings."
(2) Relating to the conduct of government. To be a "public record," a document must relate to the "conduct of government or the performance of any governmental or proprietary function." RCW 42.56.010(3).1 Almost all records held by an agency relate to the conduct of government.
(3) "Prepared, owned, used, or retained." A "public record" is a record "prepared, owned, used, or retained" by an agency. RCW 42.56.010(3).
A record can be "used" by an agency even if the agency does not actually possess the record. If an agency uses a record in its decision-making process it is a "public record."4 For example, if an agency considered technical specifications of a public works project and returned the specifications to the contractor in another state, the specifications would be a "public record" because the agency "used" the document in its decision-making process.5 The agency could be required to obtain the public record, unless doing so would be impossible. An agency cannot send its only copy of a public record to a third party for the sole purpose of avoiding disclosure.
Sometimes agency employees or officials may work on agency business from home computers or on other personal devices, or from nonagency accounts (such as a nonagency email account), creating and storing agency records on those devices or in those accounts. When the records are prepared, owned, used or retained within the scope of the employee's or official's employment, those records (including emails, texts and other records) were "used" by the agency and relate to the "conduct of government" so they are "public records."7 RCW 42.56.010(3). Agencies should instruct employees and officials that all public records, regardless of where they were created, should eventually be stored on agency computers. Agencies should ask employees and officials to keep agency-related documents with any retention requirements on home computers or personal devices in separate folders temporarily, until they are provided to the agency. An agency could also require an employee or official to routinely blind carbon copy ("bcc") work emails in a personal account back to an agency email account. If the agency receives a request for records that are located solely on employees' or officials' home computers or personal devices, or in personal accounts, the agency should direct the individual to search for and provide any responsive documents to the agency, and the agency should process the request as it would if the records were on the agency's computers or in agency-owned devices or accounts. The agency employee or official may be required by the agency to sign an affidavit describing the nature and extent of his or her search for and production of responsive public records located on a home computer or personal device, or in a nonagency account, and a description of personal records not provided with sufficient facts to show the records are not public records.

title: KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – LAWSUIT Kent School Board violated the Open Public Meetings Act - King County Case #24-2-21648-1 KNT

communications.communication:
October 22, 2024 

KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – LAWSUIT Kent School Board violated the Open Public Meetings Act - King County Case #24-2-21648-1 KNT

Via email: PublicRecords@Kent.k12.wa.us

The Open Public Meetings Act (OPMA), Chap. 42.30 RCW, requires school boards to conduct their business openly with limited exceptions. The Kent School Board violated the OPMA by privately discussing matters required to be public. Specifically, on May 15, 2024, the School Board held a two-hour closed session with a consultant to discuss goals, strategies and timelines for evaluating the Kent School Superintendent. Planning how to evaluate the Kent School District’s chief administrator is a policy matter requiring citizen engagement, not a private personnel matter.

On May 15, 2024, a majority of the School Board met privately during the planned executive session period, excluding the general public.

Consultant Larry Nyland, Ph.D., a former superintendent of the Seattle School District, attended the May 15 closed meeting of the Kent School Board.

Although RCW 42.30.110(1)(g) allows governing bodies to meet privately “to review the performance of a public employee,” which was the announced purpose of the May 15 meeting, the true purpose and nature of the meeting did not fit within that exception.

The May 15, 2024 executive session of the Kent School Board was not limited to reviewing the performance of an employee and did not fit any other exception to the openness requirements of the OPMA.

 A majority of the Kent School Board met privately in violation of the OPMA.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) regarding King County Case # 24-2-21648-1 KNT - JOSEPH RILEY AND ALLISON RILEY v. KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT, a public agency, and KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT BOARD OF DIRECTORS, a governing body.

title: FBI: Constantine Victorio "Tony" Baruso

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Constantine Victorio "Tony" Baruso
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any bureau records related to convicted criminal and union boss Constantine Victorio "Tony" Baruso (born December 28th 1927 - Died November 14th 2008).  

Mr. Baruso, a prominent labor leader and president of a Seattle-area chapter of the Alaska Cannery Workers Union, died in prison in Washington State in 2008 following a conviction for first degree murder in 1991. Baruso is alleged to have been involved in two murders that were related to the victim's political support of opponents of the regime of President Marcos of the Philippines. Considering that Mr. Baruso was a figure in a murder plot with alleged connections to foreign governments it is likely that investigations into Mr. Baruso by the bureau were undertaken following the murders in 1981. 

Baruso's 2008 death was widely reported in the news media: https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/tony-baruso-former-union-president-convicted-of-murder-dies-in-prison/

This request is for any and all records about Constantine Victorio "Tony" Baruso from any and all FBI offices, including HQ, field offices, legal attaches, and facilities that maintain records under the FBI’s control. Please conduct a search for any records on Constantine Baruso held by the Seattle or Anchorage field offices. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to Constantine Baruso.

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to Constantine Baruso. .

Please include a search of any records or documents understood to be, or colloquially referred to as "COINTELPRO records" under the bureau's custody that could be construed as responsive to a request for records related to Constantine Baruso.

Please conduct a search for any correspondence either to or from directors William Webster, William Sessions, Louis Freeh, or Robert Mueller, where Baruso is mentioned - specifically regarding the investigation into Baruso, Baruso's trial, or Baruso's imprisonment. 

Thank you for the bureau's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working together on this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Kent School District - LaKenya Moss, White Privilege, Racism, unsafe teaching environment - Request for Outside investigator - Panther Lake Elementary

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Hi – I have a public records request:

Attached are excerpts from Garrett Lombardi – Evaluation Response Panther Lake Elementary 03 21 2024 (Pages 4462-4478) as publicly posted to the internet by the Kent School District:

Boster, Dawn Marie shared a folder with you

Here's the folder that Boster, Dawn Marie shared with you.

https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2024/10/06/23-24-198.zip

This email is generated through Kent School District's use of Microsoft 365 and may contain content that is controlled by Kent School District.

Excerpts from Garrett Lombardi – Evaluation Response Panther Lake Elementary 03 21 2024:

I turned to Ms. Moss after this conversation and was walking toward the bathroom area for teachers upstairs but wanted to let her know that I was talking about her in the meeting and didn’t want to just say it was her, because it might have made her feel a certain way (some people do not like to be called out, right?). Ms. Moss turned to me and said, “why would you come up and talk to me!” I was confused at this point because I came to her to let her know she helped me with our conversation before, getting to know her classroom students and to thank her for this advice. Ms. Moss preceded to say that I (meaning me) just don’t get it. Now I am really wondering why she would phrase it in this way. We start discussing how I respected her and can see that the kids respect her, thinking that I can learn something and how to effectively communicate and help exactly what the article we just read about. She said, “you wont get it because you are white” “and that she stated, “I don’t respect her”” and that I am “privileged”, in a way, made me feel uncomfortable right at that very minute, but having respect and wanting to understand and support her I wanted to hear what she was expressing. She expressed how “there are all of the examples out there Floyd case and a few others how if I were stopped because I am “white” I would get off with a warning and let me go and that “we” (like a you people statement) don’t get it and think the cop is nice and that he would do that for everyone,” then proceeds to get emotional and states if she reached for her license they could shoot her and end her life. At this point, I advised I don’t believe that because of God, as we had a conversation before approximately a month ago in front of the school on this topic which I will touch on later. She abruptly stopped me and said “No! No! Uh don’t even go there with God!” “Don’t even bring God into this” “We are not talking about that,” (not wanting to stop the conversation only that topic is how I took it). I wanted feedback and asked Ms. Moss that I have had black students say to me “they don’t have to listen to me because I am white” which I have had conversations with admin about this before, as I have addressed concerns with admins, teachers, and the appropriate staff about any students for aggression, behavior situations, one offs, etc. per protocol letting admin know some of the more serious situations that have occurred. I mentioned this because in my mind she might be able to help me through this. Ms. Moss becomes aggravated and aggressive stating “how dare I, I have the nerve to say this to her face!” “How I should feel ashamed because I am “white” and that I am “privileged” as if she is taking this out on me.”

Mrs. Lattin opened and asked what was going on and principal Pogson asked the same. I politely asked Ms. Moss if she would like to go first. All Ms. Moss did was stare at me glaring at me in intimidation. I stated, “I’ll go first then.” I reiterated all the details above to Ms. Pogson and Mrs. Lattin. When I finished explaining the details above to the administrators, I noticed Ms. Moss glaring at me and with a face of distain. Ms. Moss forcefully and with a very scary tone said and pointed at me “Now its my turn”! When Ms. Moss completed her explanation of the events, she asked a question to me, and I wanted to respond. When I went to respond she said “I am not done! Told me no talking you don’t get to speak it’s my turn”! I asked the administrators if this was appropriate and please see the way she was losing control and how she was talking to me, as the meeting should end, I don’t know why the admins let this happen when I wanted it to stop. I was told in the evaluation I am the one in the meeting who kept insisting on talking but I wanted clarification on Mrs. Lattin statement below about the “White privilege” and I tried to explain how, that is not what Ms. Moss’s context was, nor did Ms. Moss in the meeting tell anyone in the room she was helping me see my “white privilege”. Pogson and Lattin were the ones who filled that in for Ms. Moss, which is extremely odd to me how they know what she was thinking and once again seeing the affects of putting words in other people’s mouth. I then said I wanted to answer the question and several times Mrs. Lattin refereed to this as not a court of law or hearing and why I kept speaking in a way like that. I then said, “Ms. Moss” may I answer your question and immediately Ms. Moss sat up abruptly toward me and said “uhhh! No! I am not Ms. Moss to you, you can call me Kenya, it’s after 3:50 (1550) in the afternoon pointed outside and kept saying it is after 3:50 and I am not Ms. Moss right now as if in a breakdown and hollering I am Kenya now and growled. This to me is absolutely a threat to indicate the time and it is after school and then say, “the gloves come off” and to indicate I am not Ms. Moss to you it’s Kenya I became frightened. You can even ask the admins what my face looked like… my eyes were wide, and I felt extremely scared what could happen next. I advised that this is not productive, nor would I be treated this way. I was also told by the admins “I can’t bring up God” when I was sharing the events of what the conversation was about with Ms. Moss and myself, that “I shouldn’t say that.” Even though Ms. Moss and I had a conversation about God in the front of the school that day she wanted to tell me something.

I was advised that it was appropriate for Ms. Moss to use my race “white” and say that I am privileged, and that KSD. Per Mrs. Lattin approved letting “white people” know about “White Privilege.” I responded, “what? Are you kidding me?” Not because it was implemented but because the context and how I was being treated was not appropriate all the way around. It was perceived by me that they were trying to coerce me in to believing that I was wrong, and that “Ms. Moss was only trying to help me see that I am “White Privileged” and feel ashamed.” As mentioned during my conversation with Ms. Moss in the hall that she stated, “to feel ashamed” but “not have pity on her and her people.”

Another issue I have encountered here with the Kent School District is in my role with Music at PO GR ME and CO I am in a program at W.G.U. for Elementary Education Masters. I was told by Dr. Corbley that she had no idea about any of this and that they had to hire someone and not conditionally hire me per what was promised. Not to mention I was advised to go ahead and complete grading and never got paid for this still to-date. Everyone is aware now about the falling through the cracks per the Email I received from Dr. Corbley; however, I still need to be paid.

I strive to encourage, inspire, and build leaders in public education for all! I was told yesterday that just me saying that I am saying “for all” that my “White Privilege is getting in the way” and I was told, “because I am white,” “I am ignorant of other cultures and races.” This, I feel is an attack on me, a misrepresentation which I hope for an investigation of (discrimination race and religion, deceptiveness, manipulation, retaliatory, and slander / defamation because it is going into my personal file only) and deeply saddened by the treatment I received by the very few individuals here at Panther Lake.

want to believe that some right here of my own has been violated and retaliated against, but of the direction and topic in which this has gone, it is apparent, or perceived as I’m “the problem” as stated. However, upon further investigation you will find that Mr. Holt will corroborate with my classroom management and cooperation as well as many teachers here at PL. I have, with ease, been able to address concerns with students to their teachers, and have never had a teacher respond, react, or act in this manner back to me like Ms. Moss did yesterday. Not once, from the PD meeting to the conference meeting did I break any policy or procedures / rules set forth in the Code of Conduct. If anything, I was threatened by Ms. Moss during the meeting in that she said to me “and what you don’t know is I went to Mrs. Lattin to warn her about you!”

Garrett Lombardi
Substitute K.S.D. Music / P.E. / Classroom / ASC
Garrett.Lombardi@Kent.K12.WA.US
863.521.2440

From: Heath, Randall (Randy) <Randall.Heath@kent.k12.wa.us>
Sent: Tuesday, April 2, 2024 2:09:36 PM
To: Macpherson, Anita <Anita.Macpherson@kent.k12.wa.us>
Cc: Layla Jones [WA] <ljones@washingtonea.org>; Lombardi, Garrett
<Garrett.Lombardi@kent.k12.wa.us>; Hunter, Daman <Daman.Hunter@kent.k12.wa.us>
Subject: RE: Discrimination Complaint

Good Afternoon Mr. Lombard

Thank you for calling me today to clarify who you are wanting to make the subject of your complaint. According to our conversation you indicated that the following individuals you believe contributed to the violation of your rights:

LaKenya Moss
Amanda Lattin
Pam Pogson

You believe that their actions resulted in the following impact:

Creating a hostile working environment

Resulted in you receiving an unfair negative evaluation.

Resulted in you not being able to substitute at Panther Lake which has resulted in a loss of pay. You also stated that there were concerns regarding the district as a whole in terms of Ms. Lattin’s claim that the action taken by Ms. Moss is supported and encouraged by the district. You also stated that you have had some substitute jobs (not at Panther Lake) cancelled since this occurred and wondered what was behind them being cancelled.

I explained that the timeline of the complaint is 30 calendar days which we will begin today as it was the day we were able to determine who the complaint was against. This would put a completion date of May 2. As I shared I would am asking for an extension of this timeline given that it is complicated involving multiple individuals and that there was a week of scheduled non-work days in those thirty days. I am requesting this be moved to 60 days. If you can give me the extension of 30 additional days it would be appreciated however you stated you would probably counter with an extension of smaller number of days.

I look forward to hearing back from you to confirm that I have captured basis of your complaint and how many days of extension if any you will be giving the district.

Randy

Mr. Lombardi has had several incidents at our school that were difficult situations. The first one was on his first or second day where he was asking some of our muslim students to do exercises. The students weren't comfortable so he reported to the teacher they were lazy. The teacher (and myself) explained to him that we make exceptions for religious reasons (students were asked to crawl through other students legs). The classroom teacher spoke at length to Mr. Lombardi about getting to know her students and the reason we accommodate as teachers.

I also spoke to him about the same issues.

There have been several comments that were made "those black kids" and some disparaging words that my Assistant Principal worked with him on.

Today 3/20, we were doing equity work at our PDand he approached the above teacher and tried to tell her that she helped him (per him) but the teacher is saying that he told her he didn't understand the need for the conversation we had during PD on helping boys of color. She tried to tell him that it was his privilege of being white and he got angry and told her he was going to take her to admin and the board. She told him she was ending the conversation and he continued to talk to her. He continued to press her on why she called him that and wouldn't leave her alone. She came to find admin. She stated she felt threatened and unsafe with him. We tried to negotiate the conversation with him and help him see his failure to stop when asked by a staff member and he just continued to say that it was his right to keep talking. I tried to explain white privilege to him and that it was a bias we have as white educators but he just kept asking who in HRhe needed to talk to. Being a minority/majority school I don't believe this is the appropriate place for him and my staff member doesn't feel safe with him coming back.

REQUEST FOR PUBLIC RECORDS RCW 42.56:

1. Please provide copies of all discrimination complaints filed or submitted to the district in 2023 and 2024 by any student, staff, or member of the public.

2. Please provide copies of all records the district has referencing the term "white privilege."

3. Please identify the "appropriate place" for Mr. Lombardi as described by Panther Lake Elementary Principal Pamela Pogson.

4. Please name the staff member who "doesn't feel safe with him (Lombardi) coming back." as described by Panther Lake Elementary Principal Pamela Pogson.

5. Please provide copies of all “Request for Outside Investigators” as described by Assistant to the Superintendent Carolyn Currie in her email of April 04, 2024 for the years 2023 and 2024. 

6. Please provide copies of all complaints against Panther Lake Elementary Teacher LaKenya Moss - LaKenya.Moss@kent.k12.wa.us

7. Please provide copies of all complaints against Panther Lake Elementary Principal Pamela J. Pogson - Pamela.Pogson@kent.k12.wa.us

8. Please provide copies of all complaints against Panther Lake Elementary Assistant Principal
Amanda Lattin - Amanda.Lattin@kent.k12.wa.us

9. Please provide copies of all complaints against Garrett Lombardi Substitute K.S.D. Music / P.E. / Classroom / ASC- Garrett.Lombardi@Kent.K12.WA.US 



The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Fethullah Gülen (27 April 1941 – 20 October 2024)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Fethullah Gülen (27 April 1941 – 20 October 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Turkish preacher Muhammed Fethullah Gülen (27 April 1941 – 20 October 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/21/world/europe/fethullah-gulen-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions.

1. BJJOHNSON9@CPS.EDU
2. HFDOMINGUEZ1@CPS.EDU

Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Air Force)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Air Force)
communications.communication:
Dear Air Force,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Air Force's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Office Of The Federal Register)
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the Office of the Federal Register (OFR).  

*If you are a Federal Register liaison officer or agency drafter, contact the Scheduling Unit (contact information located in the DDH) or visit our new agency resource page: https://www.archives.gov/agencies. *

If you have a question about our office or one of our publications (and it is not already answered by one or more of the following links), we will respond within 10 business days.  
  -  For comments (how to comment; how to find a comment) on a document published in the Federal Register (DO NOT send us the comment): https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs#comments

  -  For questions about specific documents in the Federal Register or content in the CFR: https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs#fr-pubs

  -  For problems with your myFR or myCFR account or to report a problem with FederalRegister.gov or eCFR.gov: https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs#tech 

  -  For questions about Presidential documents: https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs#pres-docs

  -  For questions about public laws and the U.S. Statutes at Large: https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs#laws

  -  To report a legal violation or crime: https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs#doc-qs

  -  To inspect IBR material (we do NOT provide copies), email the complete CFR citation and full description of the material to fr.inspection@nara.gov

Neither FederalRegister.gov nor eCFR.gov independently links to outside interests and we do not accept or respond to solicitations.
